title: 2024 General Election: 60 polling stations relocated from Buddhist Temples
byline: The Chairman of the Election Commission of Sri Lanka R.M.A.L. Rathnayake states that the 2024 General Election will be held on 14 November 2024 as scheduled, as the petition challenging the election date was dismissed by the Supreme Court without taking into consideration.

title: NPP will standardize Sri Lankan politics - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that the National People’s Power (NPP) is committed to transforming the country’s political culture, noting that there must be a certain standard for politics.

title: Heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology warns that heavy  showers  of about  100  mm  are  likely  at  some  places  in  Central,  Sabaragamuwa,  North-Central, Uva provinces and in Kurunegala district today (05).

title: Special commodity levy on imported sugar extended
byline: The government has decided to extend the special commodity levy of Rs. 50 per kilogram on imported sugar until December 31, continuing the levy that was originally set to expire on November 01.

title: Karapitiya Hospital’s doctors launch indefinite strike
byline: The doctors at the Karapitiya National Hospital have launched an indefinite strike starting from 8:00 a.m. today (Nov. 5), in protest over the alleged misconduct by a specialist doctor in the hospital’s oncology unit.

title: Current govt. simply continues policies of previous administrations – Dilith
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Gampaha District Parliamentary candidate, Entrepreneur Dilith Jayaweera states that the current government lacks a progressive vision and simply continues the policies of previous administrations.

title: Thai woman arrested with ‘Ice’ worth Rs. 100 million at BIA
byline: The officers of the Narcotics Control Unit at Bandaranayake International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake have arrested a female passenger at the green channel who had arrived from Malaysia with a stock of narcotic substances identified as Crystal Methamphetamine (Ice).

title: Bus accident in India’s Uttarakhand kills 36, leaves 6 injured
byline: At least 36 people were killed and six were injured after a bus plunged into a gorge in the northern Indian state of Uttarakhand on Monday, an official told Reuters.

title: Sajith slams govt. over ignored promises
byline: Leader of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Sajith Premadasa criticized the incumbent government’s failure to fulfill its promises on tax reduction, fuel price reduction and eliminating queues for passports.

title: World’s first wooden satellite, developed in Japan, heads to space
byline: The world’s first wooden satellite, built by Japanese researchers, was launched into space on Tuesday, in an early test of using timber in lunar and Mars exploration.

title: India’s Modi, Canada’s Trudeau condemn violence at Hindu temple near Toronto
byline: The prime ministers of India and Canada condemned violence that broke out on Sunday at a Hindu temple near Toronto at a time of escalating diplomatic tensions between the countries.

title: Easter attacks: SC orders to recall defence over acquittal of ex-IGP and Defence Secretary
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered the Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar to recall the defence following an appeal filed by the Attorney General (AG) challenging the verdict issued by Colombo High Court to acquit former Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fernando and former IGP Pujith Jayasundara..

title: Woman stabbed to death inside husband’s private hospital
byline: A woman has reportedly been stabbed to death with a sharp weapon inside a private hospital in Trincomalee.

title: Doctors’ strike at Karapitiya Hospital called off
byline: The indefinite strike launched by the doctors at the Karapitiya National Hospital from 8.00 a.m. today (05) has been called off.

title: Singapore named world’s most powerful passport; Sri Lanka ranks 94
byline: Singapore has been named the world’s most powerful passport again, offering its citizens visa-free access to 195 countries, according to the latest Henley Passport Index released in October 2024.

title: Lock of George Washington’s hair among historic presidential items up for auction
byline: As the world turns its attention to the US election on Nov. 5, presidential history aficionados may be particularly interested in an auction later in the month that has objects on sale ranging from a lock of George Washington’s hair to a flag that accompanied Abraham Lincoln to his final resting place.

title: Man arrested for circulating fake currency note with President’s image on social media
byline: The Criminal Investigations Department (CID) has arrested a person who is suspected to have circulated a doctored image of a fake currency note of the Rs. 5,000 denomination featuring an image of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on it.

title: CBK fears assassination plot following cut down on security
byline: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga has voiced suspicions of a possible plot to assassinate her, similar to the politically motivated assassination of her husband, the late Vijaya Kumaratunga.

title: Kamala Harris’ ancestral village in India to pray for her election victory
byline: Residents in U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris’ ancestral village in southern India were preparing to hold prayers on election day on Tuesday in a Hindu temple more than 8,000 miles (13,000 km) from Washington.

title: Drug trafficker Palani Shiran’s assets worth Rs. 80 million frozen
byline: Sri Lankan authorities have frozen assets valued at approximately Rs. 80 million belonging to notorious drug trafficker Palani Shiran Clorian, who is currently serving a prison sentence in India on drug-related charges.

title: Appeals Court upholds prison sentence for ex-Deputy Minister in bribery case
byline: The Court of Appeal has upheld a prison sentence given to former Deputy Minister Shantha Premaratne who was found guilty of the charges of obtaining a bribe of Rs. 50,000 from a woman after promising employment.

title: KDU bus accident: Driver had license suspended over drunken accident, court told
byline: It has been revealed before the court today that the bus driver involved in the recent fatal bus accident in Badulla, while transporting a group of students of the Southern Campus of the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU), previously had his driving license suspended..

title: Johnston Fernando’s writ petition withdrawn
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando has withdrawn the writ petition filed on his behalf with the Court of Appeal seeking an order to prevent his arrest.

title: South Korea fines Meta $15 million for illegally collecting information on Facebook users
byline: South Korea’s privacy watchdog on Tuesday fined social media company Meta 21.6 billion won ($15 million) for illegally collecting sensitive personal information from Facebook users, including data about their political views and sexual orientation, and sharing it with thousands of advertisers.

title: Chief Jailor and storekeeper of New Magazine Prison suspended
byline: The Chief Jailor and a prison guard who served as the storekeeper of the New Magazine Prison in Colombo have been suspended.

title: American voters head to polls as turbulent campaign concludes
byline: The dizzying presidential contest between Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Kamala Harris hurtled toward an uncertain finish on Tuesday as millions of Americans headed to the polls to choose between two sharply different visions for the country.

title: Tense situation as Pastor Jerome arrives in Nawalapitiya
byline: A tense situation had been reported in the Mipitiya area of Nawalapitiya today (05) when controversial Pastor Jerome Fernando had arrived in the area.

title: NBRO issues landslide warnings for 8 districts
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings to multiple areas in eight districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Functioning of public service must change to achieve govt’s objectives – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that rural development and upgrading the rural people’s social and economic well-being is one of the primary objectives of the government during this term, the President’s Media Division (PMD) reported.

title: Man arrested for sharing fake currency note with President’s image on social media remanded
byline: The 38-year-old person arrested from Athurugiriya for allegedly publishing a fake Rs. 5,000 currency note with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s image on social media, has been remanded until November 11 by the Kesbewa Magistrate.
